answers.answer: hello, her results show elevated  blood sugars, but not terribly so.how is her overall physical and mental health? if it's good i would  recommend trying  to manage this by eating a lower carb diet, meaning less sweets and sweet foods, and  focus  on whole foods.  also keep physically active walking or joining seniors exercise class.you could ask her dr if metformin / glucophage is an option. this may help slow progression of high blood sugars.agressive management may not be appropriate, but management may still be.  read up on diabetes, but please ignore the recommendation in some sites to eat lots of carbs as these will make her sugars higher. as previously  mentioned a lower carb approach tends  to work better for most, particularly if only lifestyle measures are adopted.
